channel.title: CyberNetSec - Regulatory
channel.description: Latest regulatory threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: 700Credit Data Breach Exposes PII of 5.6 Million Individuals
item.description:
The U.S. fintech company 700Credit, a major provider of credit reports and data services to the automotive industry, has disclosed a data breach affecting at least 5.6 million individuals. The incident, which occurred in October 2025, resulted in an unauthorized actor gaining access to and stealing ...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: LastPass Fined £1.2M by UK Regulator Over 2022 Security Failures
item.description:
The UK's Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) has fined password manager provider LastPass £1.2 million (approximately $1.6 million) for significant security failures that led to a major data breach in 2022. The regulator found that LastPass failed to implement adequate technical and security mea...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Regulatory, Data Breach, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Eswatini Faces Cybersecurity Crisis as Government Fails to Act on Rising Threats
item.description:
A report published on December 13, 2025, reveals a deepening cybersecurity crisis in the Kingdom of Eswatini. The nation is experiencing a significant increase in cyberattacks targeting citizens, businesses, and government bodies. This surge is compounded by a lack of effective government response, ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Other

item.title: CISA Updates Cybersecurity Performance Goals for Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
On December 11, CISA released an updated version of its voluntary Cybersecurity Performance Goals (CPGs), designed to help critical infrastructure operators bolster their defenses. The new version aligns with the latest NIST standards and places a stronger emphasis on governance, accountability, and...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory

item.title: Conduent Breach Exposes 10.5M Patients, Ranks as 8th Largest US Healthcare Breach
item.description:
Business services giant Conduent has disclosed a massive data breach that exposed the personal and medical information of over 10.5 million people, making it the 8th largest healthcare data breach in U.S. history. The breach, which was active for months between October 2024 and January 2025, has alr...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: TriZetto Discloses Year-Long Data Breach Exposing Patient PHI
item.description:
TriZetto Provider Solutions, a healthcare revenue management company owned by Cognizant, has started notifying clients about a major data breach. An unauthorized party had access to patient data for nearly a full year, from November 2024 until the breach was detected on October 2, 2025. The attacker...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Incident Response, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: Race for Secure Digital Identity Heats Up with New Platforms from IBM and Turing Space
item.description:
The digital identity space is seeing rapid innovation as IBM launches "Verify Digital Credentials," a new platform for issuing and authenticating secure digital documents like licenses and academic records. Built on open standards, it aims to reduce breach risk by decentralizing data storage. Concur...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Cloud Security

item.title: White House Sets 2025 Deadline for Post-Quantum Crypto Readiness
item.description:
The White House has issued a new Executive Order to accelerate the U.S. federal government's transition to post-quantum cryptography (PQC). The order sets a critical deadline of December 1, 2025, for several key initiatives. It directs CISA and the NSA to create and maintain a list of commercially a...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Iran Bans Officials From Using All Internet-Connected Devices Over Espionage Fears
item.description:
In a drastic measure to combat espionage, Iran's Cybersecurity Command has banned all government officials and their security staff from using any device connected to public communication networks. The directive, reported on December 5, 2025, includes smartphones, laptops, and smartwatches. The move...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Ransomware Payments Exceed $2.1 Billion Since 2022, FinCEN Reports
item.description:
A new Financial Trend Analysis from the U.S. Treasury's Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN), released December 4, 2025, reveals that financial institutions reported over $2.1 billion in ransomware-related payments between January 2022 and December 2024. The data, derived from Bank Secrecy ...
